content.title: Financial Assistance for Self-Marriage of Registered Women Workers (HBOCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Self-Marriage of Registered Women Workers' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB). Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to registered women workers for arranging their own marriage. Women workers who are registered members for at least one year and have not received marriage assistance for their own marriage from any other government department/board/corporation are eligible to avail the benefits of this scheme.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50,000/- is provided to registered women workers for arranging their own marriage.
eligibility: The applicant should be a woman and engaged in building or construction work.
The applicants should be registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The registered woman worker must have a minimum one-year regular membership.
The registered woman worker must have an active membership with the Board.
The registered woman worker shall submit an undertaking/self-declaration that she has not received and will not receive this assistance from any other Government Department/Board/Corporation.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card
An undertaking/self-declaration that she has not received and will not receive this assistance from any other Government Department/Board/Corporation.

faqs.question: What does the scheme offer?
faqs.answer: It offers financial assistance to registered women workers for arranging their own marriage.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A financial assistance of ₹50,000/- is provided to registered women workers.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Women engaged in building or construction work, registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and having at least one year of regular membership are eligible.

faqs.question: What is the minimum membership duration required for eligibility?
faqs.answer: A minimum of one year's regular membership with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board is required.

faqs.question: What declaration is necessary for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Applicants must submit an undertaking/self-declaration stating they have not received and will not receive similar assistance from any other Government Department/Board/Corporation.

faqs.question: Where can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply through the official website of the Labour Department, Haryana.

faqs.question: Are there any documents required for the application?
faqs.answer: Required documents may include proof of registration with the Board, identity proof, marriage certificate and the undertaking/self-declaration form.

faqs.question: Can applicants check the status of their application?
faqs.answer: Yes, Workers can track their application status online through the official website of the Labour Department Haryana.
